COMMAND.name: show qos
COMMAND.ACTION:
cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_global/check_qos_enable/1 if [ "$?" != "0" ]; then exit 1 fi
case "${dir}" in "all") if [ ${domain_type} == "cos-domain" ];then cdbctl show/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/type/cos-tc-color/ cdbctl show/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/type/tc-color-cos/ elif [ ${domain_type} == "dscp-domain" ];then cdbctl show/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/type/dscp-tc-color/ cdbctl show/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/type/tc-color-dscp/ elif [ ${domain_type} == "exp-domain" ];then cdbctl show/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/type/exp-tc-color/ cdbctl show/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/type/tc-color-exp/ fi ;; "ingress") if [ ${domain_type} == "cos-domain" ];then cdbctl show/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/type/cos-tc-color/ elif [ ${domain_type} == "dscp-domain" ];then cdbctl show/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/type/dscp-tc-color/ elif [ ${domain_type} == "exp-domain" ];then cdbctl show/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/type/exp-tc-color/ fi ;; "egress") if [ ${domain_type} == "cos-domain" ];then cdbctl show/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/type/tc-color-cos/ elif [ ${domain_type} == "dscp-domain" ];then cdbctl show/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/type/tc-color-dscp/ elif [ ${domain_type} == "exp-domain" ];then cdbctl show/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/type/tc-color-exp/ fi ;; esac
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to display the both ingress and egress information of QoS map-table.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display the information of map-table in QoS cos-domain 0. Switch# show qos cos-domain 0 map-table all

COMMAND.name: show qos mpls-label exp-domain
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to display qos exp-domain of mpls label .
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display qos exp-domain of mpls label. Switch# show qos mpls-label exp-domain

COMMAND.name: show qos global
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to display the information of QoS global.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display the information of qos global. Switch# show qos global

COMMAND.name: qos cos-domain
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to creat a qos cos-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to creat qos cos-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos cos-domain 1

COMMAND.name: qos dscp-domain
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to creat a qos dscp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to creat qos dscp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos dscp-domain 1

COMMAND.name: qos exp-domain
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to creat a qos exp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to creat qos exp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos exp-domain 1

COMMAND.name: qos mpls-label
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set mpls label exp domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: All mpls label default exp domain is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set mpls label 300 exp domain 2. Switch(config)# qos mpls-label 300 exp-domain 2

COMMAND.name: no qos mpls-label
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to restore mpls label default exp domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: All mpls label default exp domain is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to restore mpls label 300 default exp domain. Switch(config)# no qos mpls-label exp-domain

COMMAND.name: qos mpls-label range
COMMAND.help: Configurate mpls label exp domain list

COMMAND.name: no qos mpls-label range
COMMAND.help: Restore mpls label exp domain list

COMMAND.name: exit
COMMAND.help: Exit from qos global configuration mode

COMMAND.name: quit
COMMAND.help: Exit from qos global configuration mode

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

COMMAND.name: qos enable
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to enable qos.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: Qos disable
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable qos Switch(config-qos-global)# qos enable

COMMAND.name: no qos enable
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to disable qos.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: Qos disable
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to disable qos. Switch(config-qos-global)# no qos enable

COMMAND.name: qos ipg
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set qos rate-limiting if include ipg or not.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: Enable
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to enable qos ipg Switch(config-qos-global)# qos ipg enable

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

COMMAND.name: cos

PARAM.name: cos_value
PARAM.help: Select which COS will be specified map

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping cos to tc and color in qos cos-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: cos x to tc x and color green. Such as cos 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set cos 2 to tc 5 color yellow in qos cos-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos cos-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-cos-domain-1)# cos 2 to tc 5 color yellow

COMMAND.name: no cos

PARAM.name: cos_value
PARAM.help: Select which COS will be specified map

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping cos to tc and color in qos cos-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: cos x to tc x and color green. Such as cos 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default cos to tc and color mapping in qos cos-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos cos-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-cos-domain-1)#no cos 2 to tc

COMMAND.name: cos range
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${type}" == "phb" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/cos2phb/${cos_value}/${map_value}/ else cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/cos2tc/${cos_value}/${map_value}/ if [ "$?" == "0" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/cos2color/${cos_value}/${color_value}/ fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping cos range to tc and color in qos cos-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: cos x to tc x and color green. Such as cos 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set cos 2-5 to tc 2 and color yellow mapping in qos cos-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos cos-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-cos-domain-1)#cos range 2-5 to tc 2 color yellow

COMMAND.name: no cos range
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${type}" == "phb" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/cos2phb/${cos_value}// else cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/cos2tc/${cos_value}// if [ "$?" == "0" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/cos2color/${cos_value}// fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, cos range to tc and color in qos cos-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: cos x to tc x and color green. Such as cos 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default mapping about cos 2-5 to tc and color in qos cos-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos cos-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-cos-domain-1)#no cos range 2-5 to tc

COMMAND.name: tc
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping, tc and color to cos in qos cos-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: tc x and color all to cos x. Such as tc 3 and color green to cos 3.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set qos mapping about tc 3 and color yellow to cos 6 in qos cos-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos cos-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-cos-domain-1)#tc 3 color yellow to cos 6

COMMAND.name: no tc
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, tc and color to cos in qos cos-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: tc x and color all to cos x. Such as tc 3 and color green to cos 3.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default qos mapping about tc 3 and color yellow to cos in qos cos-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos cos-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-cos-domain-1)#no tc 3 color yellow to cos

COMMAND.name: tc range
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping, tc range and color to cos in qos cos-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: tc x and color all to cos x. Such as tc 3 and color green to cos 3.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set qos mapping about tc range 2-4 and color yellow to cos 6 in qos cos-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos cos-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-cos-domain-1)#tc range 2-4 color yellow to cos 6

COMMAND.name: no tc range
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, tc range and color to cos in qos cos-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is : tc x and color all to cos x. Such as tc 3 and color green to cos 3.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default qos mapping about tc range 2-4 and color yellow to cos in qos cos-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos cos-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-cos-domain-1)#no tc range 2-4 color yellow to cos

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

COMMAND.name: dscp

PARAM.name: dscp_value
PARAM.help: Select which DSCP will be specified map

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping, dscp to tc and color in qos dscp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: dscp x to tc x/8 and color green. Such as dscp 12 to tc 1 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set qos mapping about dscp 12 to tc 3 and color yellow in qos dscp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos dscp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-dscp-domain-1)#dscp 12 to tc 3 color yellow

COMMAND.name: no dscp

PARAM.name: dscp_value
PARAM.help: Select which DSCP will be specified map

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, dscp to tc and color in qos dscp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: dscp x to tc x/8 and color green. Such as dscp 12 to tc 1 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default qos mapping about dscp 12 to tc and color in qos dscp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos dscp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-dscp-domain-1)#no dscp 12 to tc

COMMAND.name: dscp range
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping, dscp range to tc and color in qos dscp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: dscp x to tc x/8 and color green. Such as cos 12 to tc 1 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set qos mapping about dscp 0-20 to tc 3 and color yellow in qos dscp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos dscp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-dscp-domain-1)#dscp range 0-20 to tc 3 color yellow

COMMAND.name: no dscp range
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, dscp range to tc and color in qos dscp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is : dscp x to tc x/8 and color green. Such as cos 12 to tc 1 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default qos mapping about dscp 0-15 to tc and color in qos dscp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos dscp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-dscp-domain-1)#no dscp range 0-15 to tc

COMMAND.name: tc
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping, tc and color to dscp in qos dscp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: tc x and color all to dscp x*8. Such as tc 3 and color green to dscp 24.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set qos mapping about tc 3 and color yellow to dscp 56 in qos dscp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos dscp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-dscp-domain-1)#tc 3 color yellow to dscp 56

COMMAND.name: no tc
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, tc and color to dscp in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: tc x and color all to dscp x*8. Such as tc 3 and color green to dscp 24.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default qos mapping about tc 3 and color yellow to dscp in qos domain 1. Switch(config)# qos dscp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-dscp-domain-1)#no tc 3 color yellow to dscp

COMMAND.name: tc range
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping, tc range and color to dscp in qos dscp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: tc x and color all to dscp x*8. Such as tc 3 and color green to dscp 24.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set qos mapping about tc range 2-4 and color yellow to dscp 56 in qos dscpdomain 1. Switch(config)# qos dscp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-dscp-domain-1)#tc range 2-4 color yellow to dscp 56

COMMAND.name: no tc range
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, tc range and color to dscp in qos dscp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is : tc x and color all to dscp x*8. Such as tc 3 and color green to dscp 24.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default qos mapping about tc range 2-4 and color yellow to dscp in qos dscp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos dscp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-dscp-domain-1)#no tc range 2-4 color yellow to dscp

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

COMMAND.name: exp

PARAM.name: exp_value
PARAM.help: Select which EXP will be specified map

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping exp to tc and color in qos exp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: exp x to tc x and color green. Such as exp 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set exp 2 to tc 5 color yellow in qos exp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos exp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-exp-domain-1)#exp 2 to tc 5 color yellow

COMMAND.name: no exp

PARAM.name: exp_value
PARAM.help: Select which EXP will be specified map

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping exp to tc and color in qos exp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: exp x to tc x and color green. Such as exp 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default exp to tc and color mapping in qos exp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos exp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-exp-domain-1)#no exp 2 to tc

COMMAND.name: exp range
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${type}" == "phb" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/exp2phb/${exp_value}/${map_value}/ else cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/exp2tc/${exp_value}/${map_value}/ if [ "$?" == "0" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/exp2color/${exp_value}/${color_value}/ fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping exp range to tc and color in qos exp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: exp x to tc x and color green. Such as exp 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set exp 2-5 to tc 2 and color yellow mapping in qos exp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos exp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-exp-domain-1)#exp range 2-5 to tc 2 color yellow

COMMAND.name: no exp range
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "${type}" == "phb" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/exp2phb/${exp_value}// else cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/exp2tc/${exp_value}// if [ "$?" == "0" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/qos/qos_domain/${id}/exp2color/${exp_value}// fi fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, exp range to tc and color in qos exp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: exp x to tc x and color green. Such as exp 2 to tc 2 color green.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default mapping about exp 2-5 to tc and color in qos exp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos exp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-exp-domain-1)#no exp range 2-5 to tc

COMMAND.name: tc
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping, tc and color to exp in qos exp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: tc x and color all to exp x. Such as tc 3 and color green to exp 3.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set qos mapping about tc 3 and color yellow to exp 6 in qos exp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos exp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-exp-domain-1)#tc 3 color yellow to exp 6

COMMAND.name: no tc
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, tc and color to exp in qos exp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: tc x and color all to exp x. Such as tc 3 and color green to exp 3.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default qos mapping about tc 3 and color yellow to exp in qos exp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos exp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-exp-domain-1)#no tc 3 color yellow to exp

COMMAND.name: tc range
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure qos mapping, tc range and color to exp in qos domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is: tc x and color all to exp x. Such as tc 3 and color green to exp 3.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set qos mapping about tc range 2-4 and color yellow to exp 6 in qos exp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos exp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-exp-domain-1)#tc range 2-4 color yellow to exp 6

COMMAND.name: no tc range
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure default qos mapping, tc range and color to exp in qos exp-domain.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default mapping is : tc x and color all to exp x. Such as tc 3 and color green to exp 3.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default qos mapping about tc range 2-4 and color yellow to exp in qos exp-domain 1. Switch(config)# qos exp-domain 1 Switch(config-qos-exp-domain-1)#no tc range 2-4 color yellow to exp

COMMAND.name: qos cos-domain
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure QoS cos-domain for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to change the QoS cos-domain of interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default QoS cos-domain for each interface is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure QoS cos-domain for an interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# qos cos-domain 5

COMMAND.name: qos dscp-domain
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure QoS dscp-domain for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to change the QoS dscp-domain of interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default QoS dscp-domain for each interface is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure QoS dscp-domain for an interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# qos dscp-domain 5

COMMAND.name: no qos cos-domain
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set defalut QoS cos-domain for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to set defalut QoS cos-domain for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default QoS cos-domain for an interface is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to restore default QoS cos-domain for an interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no qos cos-domain

COMMAND.name: no qos dscp-domain
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set defalut QoS dscp-domain for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to set defalut QoS dscp-domain for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default QoS dscp-domain for an interface is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to restore default QoS dscp-domain for an interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no qos dscp-domain

COMMAND.name: replace dscp
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure replace dscp for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configre replace dscp of interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default action of replace dscp for each interface is disable.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure replace dscp for an interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# replace dscp

COMMAND.name: no replace dscp
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To return to the default action of replace dscp, use this command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to change the replace dscp action of interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default action of replace dscp for each interface is disable.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to cancel this setting. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no replace dscp

COMMAND.name: replace cos
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure replace cos for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to configre replace cos of interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default action of replace cos for each interface is disable.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure replace cos for an interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# replace cos

COMMAND.name: no replace cos
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To return to the default action of replace cos, use this command.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command is used to change the replace cos action of interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default action of replace cos for each interface is disable.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to cancel this setting. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no replace cos

COMMAND.name: trust
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to configure trust type for an interface. Such as trust cos, trust dscp, trust port.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default trust state of an interface is trust cos.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to configure trust dscp-exp for an interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# trust dscp

COMMAND.name: no trust
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set default trust state for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default trust state of an interface is trust cos.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set default trust state for an interface. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no trust

COMMAND.name: set cos
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set interface cos.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default cos of an interface is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set interface eth-0-1 cis 5. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# set cos 5

COMMAND.name: no set cos
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set default cos for an interface.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default cos of an interface is 0.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to set interface eth-0-1 default cos. Switch(config)# interface eth-0-1 Switch(config-if-eth-0-1)# no set cos
